title: Classic Sausage Stuffing for Thanksgiving Family

description: This Classic Sausage Stuffing is the ultimate Thanksgiving side dish that brings warmth and comfort to your holiday table. Buttery and savory with a crispy edge, it’s a must-try for your festive gatherings. Impress your guests with this foolproof recipe!
instructions: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat and sauté onion and celery until soft.
Add crumbled sausage and cook until browned.
In a large bowl, combine bread cubes, sausage mixture, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Pour in chicken broth gradually until the mixture is moist but not soggy.
Transfer to a greased baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes until golden brown.
tips: For perfect results, ensure the bread is slightly stale for better absorption of flavors.

structured_content.content: This Classic Sausage Stuffing is a beloved holiday dish that brings together the rich flavors of sausage and herbs, creating a comforting side that pairs perfectly with turkey. The crispy edges and buttery texture make it irresistible!

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 2 hours
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for Thanksgiving and holiday gatherings
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Foolproof method for perfect stuffing every time

structured_content.content: Growing up, this stuffing was always the highlight of our Thanksgiving dinner. The aroma of sausage and herbs would fill the house, bringing everyone together around the table.

• Main ingredient: Use fresh sausage for the best flavor; crumbled or bulk works well.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Sage and thyme are essential for that classic stuffing taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: Bread cubes should be slightly stale for optimal texture.
  • Equipment needed: A large skillet and a baking dish are essential for this recipe.

upload.context: Preparation of ingredients for sausage stuffing, showcasing the chopped vegetables and cubed bread.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by preheating your oven and preparing your ingredients. Sauté the vegetables until soft.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Cook the sausage until browned, then combine with bread and broth before baking.
Finishing Touches:
Let the stuffing cool slightly before serving to enhance flavors.

upload.context: Cooking process of sausage stuffing, highlighting the mixture in the skillet.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure the bread is stale for better texture.
  • Avoid over-soaking the bread to prevent mushiness.
  • Look for a golden brown top as a sign of doneness.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container and reheat in the oven.

structured_content.content: This stuffing is more than just a side dish; it's a tradition that brings family together. Sharing it with loved ones makes every bite even more special.
Consider adding cranberries or nuts for a unique twist, or use different types of bread for varied textures and flavors.
Serve alongside roasted turkey, mashed potatoes, and gravy for a complete holiday meal.
For a gluten-free option, use gluten-free bread, or for a vegetarian version, substitute sausage with mushrooms and additional herbs.

upload.context: Final plated dish of sausage stuffing, beautifully garnished and ready to serve.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use a mix of sausage types for depth of flavor.
  • Chop vegetables finely for even cooking.
  • Timing is key; bake until crispy on top.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for a pop of color.

structured_content.content: Enjoy the process of making this stuffing and the joy it brings to your holiday celebrations. You’ll feel proud serving this delicious dish!
